sentence: He pretends like he is standing up to anti-Semitism on  campuses, but what he is really trying to do is make clear that  protests against his policies on campuses will result in Federal  funding being cut off.
title: Authorizing Representation By the Senate Legal Counsel in the Case of Desmond Bellard V. Ronald Wyden, U.S. Senator

sentence: More than $3 billion in Federal funding has been cut from HBCUs,  Black communities, and Black entrepreneurs.
title: Recognizing Myesha Watkins

sentence: Funding was cut off at the beginning of the Trump administration  under the so-called DOGE initiative, and every day that this product  sits in warehouses in Rhode Island is a day that children around the  world are unnecessarily dying.
title: Global Report on Food Crisis

sentence: There is still work to be done, including getting this bill across  the finish line and restoring vital funding that was cut by the current  administration for treatment and recovery.
title: Calling for Permanent Scheduling for Fentanyl Analogues

sentence: Last week,  the Trump administration issued a letter to those schools saying that  they must certify that they will end the use of diversity, equity, and  inclusion in our public schools, or they will have their Federal  funding cut.

sentence: While House Republicans debate which critical funding to cut, Donald  Trump is raking in the excess to expand his personal empire.

sentence: The Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education funding bill was  cut from the same cloth as the agriculture funding bill we are  preparing to conference.
And $880 billion in Medicaid funding cuts, that is not trimming the  fat.
title: Privileges of the Floor

sentence: Standing up for science is more important than ever right now because  the reality is this administration has declared a war on science with  DOGE, funding cuts, firing contractors, firing scientists and  innovators, and trying to chase others out.
title: Stop Trump's Chaos--Stand Up for Science

sentence: When you cut special education funding, cut the Department of  Education, and cut the staff, no one can speak out for the children who  need these programs the most--children like my nephew RJ, who was born  premature and has dealt with developmental delays all his life.
title: Protecting Education for Children with Disabilities

sentence: The problem is that even though this funding has not been  cut and it is still available, the Trump administration still continues  to hold up the money instead of getting it to companies like Edesia in  North Kingstown, Rhode Island, who manufacture this food aid to ship it  around the world.
title: Funding for Edesia's Plumpy'nut

sentence: So many of our school districts--they could be urban,  suburban, or rural--depend on Federal funding, and when you cut that,  it leads to higher property taxes to make up for the loss of money.
title: Nomination of Linda McMahon

sentence: Last week,  the Department of Education sent a letter to thousands of public  schools across the country asking them to certify that they would end  programs promoting diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility or  they would have their Federal funding cut.
title: Hands Off Our Education

sentence: Instead of  accelerating those clinical trials, instead of offering funding for  that research to continue, instead of wanting to be a champion of the  cure for cancer, this administration cut that research, cut that  funding, and cut those clinical trials.
title: Trump's First 100 Days

sentence: My colleagues have also proposed gutting the mental health block grant,  the substance abuse block grant, the State opioid response grants, and  consolidating them into one program with a deep funding cut.
title: Support for Patients and Communities Reauthorization Act of 2025
